timeline.bodyText: ❓ Did you mean to leave these comments in?

replies.bodyText: I did not mean to leave the comments in, no. Unfortunately, there seems to be no way to audit in these components anymore as they are wired up via jetty.xml not anything in osgi
replies.author: stustison

timeline.message: DDF-5900 added security logger service, permissions service, and subject utils service

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if we could do something like this in the API, and have a SecurityLogger::getInstance() method or something. Then the audit logging would be similar to normal logging and we could avoid having to pass it around everywhere.
timeline.author: SmithJosh

replies.bodyText: Then we're still passing an implementation in the api, which is what I was trying to avoid.
replies.author: stustison

replies.bodyText:
You'd still have the api/impl split though so you can hide the implementation dependencies from clients. As described it would make the API OSGI-specific, but you could probably make that pluggable too.
Just a thought, not a suggestion for this PR.
replies.author: SmithJosh

replies.bodyText: I'm going to leave it as is for now.
replies.author: stustison

timeline.bodyText: ❓ Why not use the *Impl naming convention like the others?
timeline.author: SmithJosh

replies.bodyText: I was torn between making it an impl or leaving it with the name everyone is used to. I didn't want to make SubjectUtils and SubjectUtilsImpl like I did with the others, because I hate "utils"
replies.author: stustison
